docs.text: About Me I love fiddling with hardware and making machines do things they're not supposed to do. In my free time I'm ideally driving around Los Angeles freeways or hiking in one of its many mountain trails. I'm always trying to get the most out of the devices I own, and by that I mean that I tend to make them things they were not designed to do. Hopefully this project would help me keep track of my many projects. My Languages A native Spanish and also as a second thongue English Speaker, I am currently able to program in Python and Bash, looking to automate most of the tasks as a Linux Admin At Home, but I also have some knowledge of C# (pronounced C-Sharp for those around my age) due to some libraries implemented in a professional project of my own. My Mission Become a CyberSecurity Professional. My Vision In 5 years from now, be able to perform security analysis for small-medium sized companies or be able to help people mantain their networks secured. In 10 years I hope to reach the professionalismt that would allow me to start my own consulting firm, always mantaining the idea of helping other people keep their information private and secure. My Training & Certifications TryHackMe HomeLab with Proxmox Server running a different VM's from VulnHub Certifications Pending...

docs.text: Monterey Hackintosh Build About my build This build was put together using recycled parts that I got from the local used marketplace, looking for deals on anybody who upgraded to 12th gen Intel chips. Hardware specifications Intel Core i7 11700KF AsRock Z590C-AC Motherboard Intel AX200 Wireless Card G-Skill 3200MHz DDR4 16GB x2 Maple Ridge Thunderbolt4 Card AsRock Radeon RX 6800 16GB GPU SK Hynix OEM 512GB Nvme SSD Current Issues Bluetooth doesn't work. The motherboard came with a Broadcomm BT card, but even after swapping it for the AX Bluetooth, it didn't work. On-Board Audio doesn't work. My workaround is to plug in my earphones into my monitor, AMD Radeon seems to handle the audio pretty well.
docs.title: Monterey Hackintosh Build

docs.title: Current Issues

docs.text: Using a LG 5K Mac Monitor on PC The 2016 LG UltraFine 5k monitor of 27" I found in the trash works absolutely fine with my MacBook via Thunderbolt3, but I wanted to use this one with my hackintosh, so I decided to add a Thunderbolt card to my build.
docs.title: Using a LG 5K Mac Monitor on PC
